chart.title: Gender marker change
chart.subtitle: Possibility of changing one's gender in official national documents.
selection: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

Right to change legal gender (historical.descriptionShort: Describes the legislation status of the right to change legal gender. This is the legal recognition of sex reassignment by permitting a change of legal gender on an individual's birth certificate.
Right to change legal gender (historical.descriptionProcessing:
- We have extracted the data from the official [Equaldex JSON API](https://equaldex.stoplight.io/docs/equaldex/d033e28a5cf0c-equaldex-json-api).
- We combine the historical and current data extracted from the API to create a time series.
- Whenever policy implementation dates for a status are not provided in the data, and this status is the only available for the country, we consider that this status has not changed during the entire period of the dataset.
- We group some of the categories the source has defined for each issue, for further clarity in our visualizations.
- We present this data only for sovereign states, defined by [Butcher and Griffiths (2020)](https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/sovereign-state-butcher-griffiths). We use the definitions of the latest year available.
Right to change legal gender (historical.citationShort: Equaldex (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data
Right to change legal gender (historical.citationLong: Equaldex (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Gender marker change” [dataset]. Equaldex, “Equaldex” [original data].
